Sure, here are some scavenger hunt game ideas for your cousin's Batman themed party:

1. Batman's Missing Gear: Create a list of Batman's gear, such as his cowl, utility belt, batarang, etc. Hide these items around the party area and give each child a list of clues to find them. The child who finds the most gear items wins.
2. Gotham City Villain Hunt: Hide pictures of Batman's villains such as The Joker, Penguin, Catwoman, and Riddler around the party area. Give each child a list of clues to find these villains. The child who finds the most villains wins.
3. The Riddler's Puzzle Challenge: Create a series of riddles related to Batman and his universe. Each riddle should lead the children to a new location where they will find the next riddle. The final riddle leads to a treasure chest filled with Batman goodies.
4. Batman's Scavenger Hunt: Hide Batman-themed items such as toys, stickers, and posters around the party area. Give each child a list of clues to find these items. The child who finds the most items wins.
5. Batmobile Race: Hide miniature Batmobiles around the party area. Divide the children into teams and give each team a list of clues to find the Batmobiles. The first team to find all the Batmobiles and return them to the starting point wins.
6. Save the City Challenge: Divide the children into teams and give them a set of clues to find the pieces of a puzzle that, when put together, reveal a map of Gotham City. Each team must then use the map to find and rescue hostages hidden around the party area. The team that rescues the most hostages wins.

Make sure to incorporate Batman and his universe into each scavenger hunt game idea to keep the party theme consistent and exciting for your cousin and his friends.

Choosing a gift for a 5-year-old boy can be exciting yet challenging at the same time. Here are some ideas for gifts that your cousin may enjoy:

1. Batman Action Figures or Toys: Since your cousin loves Batman, an action figure or toy related to the character would be an ideal gift. You can choose from a variety of options such as Batman figurines, Batman costumes, or even a remote-controlled Batmobile.
2. Art and Craft Supplies: Most children enjoy arts and crafts, and your cousin may also enjoy creating his Batman-themed artwork. You can gift him a set of crayons, paints, sketchbooks, stickers, or even a Batman coloring book.
3. Books: Age-appropriate books with Batman stories, comics or even picture books can be a great gift for a young child. It can be a fun way to introduce him to reading while keeping his love for Batman alive.
4. Games: Board games, card games or video games that feature Batman and his universe can be an excellent gift for a child who loves playing games.
5. Outdoor Play Equipment: If your cousin enjoys spending time outside, you can consider gifting him some outdoor play equipment such as a Batman-themed scooter, a bike, or even a ball.
6. Puzzle: You can gift him a Batman-themed puzzle that he can put together and hang in his room.

These are just a few ideas to consider. Make sure to choose a gift that aligns with your cousin's interests, personality, and age.
